page.title: 07Winterbourne Now & Then
page.content: In 1931 the population of Winterbourne was 3,554. It has grown a great deal since that time and in 1977 had reached 10,330. There used to be an old police station next door to the Royal Oak public house but this was demolished in 1959 to make way for a road widening scheme. The nearest police station today is about 5 kilometres away. The railway station was closed in 1964 and people had to find alternative means of transport until the opening of Parkway Station in 1972. From the 1920s St. Michael's was the only school in the village until the Ridings High School opened in 1957. This became a comprehensive in 1969. Our school, Elm Park, opened in 1960. There has been a library in the area for the last 18 years. Like many villages Winterbourne has changed a lot over the years.
